title: The Bachelor: Abbie Chatfield wants to be the next Bachelorette
text:
She failed to find love with the Bachelor's Matt Agnew.

But runner-up Abbie Chatfield has revealed she would put her love life in the hands of TV producers for a second time.

Speaking to the Daily Telegraph's Sydney Confidential, the 23-year-old said: 'I would love to be the Bachelorette.'

Second time lucky? Abbie Chatfield (pictured) has revealed she would put her love life in the hands of TV producers for a second time

'But I think it's a really hard gig because you're basically by yourself … I'd definitely consider (it though), I think it would be lots of fun.'

Abbie made it to the finale of The Bachelor earlier this year, but was left heartbroken when astrophysicist Matt chose Chelsie McLeod instead.

In recent weeks, Abbie has been spotted enjoying herself with Bachelorette runner-up Todd.

Fun in the sun! Abbie has been spotted enjoying herself with Bachelorette runner-up Todd King

Their public displays of affection have sparked rumours of a possible romance.

They've been seen enjoying a passionate kiss on more than one occasion but despite locking lips, Abbie has denied the pair are dating.

She said they've been on a couple of dates, but with Todd based in Perth, the distance has proved tricky.

Rumour, rumour: Abbie said she had been on a couple of dates with Bachelorette runner-up Todd King (pictured)

'We had two dates. We just pashed [kissed] on a couple of dates,' she previously said when quizzed about their relationship on the podcast Outspoken.

'I'm just a normal chick on a beach with a friend on a date getting to know someone.'

But Abbie has revealed she is considering a move from her home in Brisbane to Sydney, where Channel Ten's hit show The Bachelorette is filmed.

So close! Abbie made it to the finale of The Bachelor earlier this year, but was left heartbroken when astrophysicist Matt Agnew (pictured) chose Chelsie McLeod
description: She failed to find love with the Bachelor's Matt Agnew.
authors: Jess Bell For Daily Mail Australia
